## Background
The Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada (AAFC) launched the Canada Brand in 2006 to support the growth and success of Canadian agri-food businesses and associations in the global market. In recognition of the increased online consumer presence due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the Canada Brand was refreshed in 2023 with new graphics, tools, and marketing strategies developed for the digital environment.

## Campaign Overview
To promote Canadian products and drive consumer demand in the Japanese market, AAFC undertook a 12-month targeted consumer campaign featuring a Canada Fair showcase on Rakuten, the most extensive e-commerce platform in Japan. This campaign included social media collaborations, digital marketing and a consumer-facing website, culminating on February 29, 2024.

## Tenders
AAFC has successfully procured the design and execution of the e-commerce Canada Fair showcase to Rakuten. As part of the next tender, AAFC aims to retain Rakuten Group Inc. to maintain the showcase on its platform for another two-year period from March 1, 2024, to February 28, 2025.

## Objective
Rakuten Group Inc. must successfully host, maintain and update the Canada Fair e-commerce marketplace on the Rakuten platform, facilitate increased Canadian food product availability and drives traffic to the showcase through seasonal promotions and performance metrics reporting.

## Key Deliverables
Successful candidates must commit to:

* Host and maintain the Canada Fair showcase page, complete with Canada Brand content to enhance brand recognition and Canadian food awareness in Japan
* Maintain the availability of Canadian food on the Canada Fair showcase
* Facilitate increased Canadian food product listings and suppliers to drive purchasing opportunities
* Enhance the visibility of Canadian food products through promotional tools and reports

## Performance Metrics
Rakuten Group Inc. will be beneficiaries of bimonthly detailed performance reports, with baseline statistics of sales and traffic.
